ContentClassification.TableReference: National Association of Insurance Commissioners, "1985 NAIC Cancer Claim Cost Tables", Proceedings of the National Association of Insurance Commissioners, Vol. I. (Kansas City, Mo. 1986)
ContentClassification.TableName: 1985 NAIC Cancer Claim Cost Table All-Payment Conversion Factors
ContentClassification.TableDescription: 1985 National Association of Insurance Commissioners (NAIC) Cancer Claim Cost Table All-Payment Conversion Factors. Minimum Attained Age: 15. Maximum Attained Age: 99
ContentClassification.Comments: Study Data: Based on lives insured under cancer expense policies. Claim information includes payments during 1978 and 1979. It is believed 80% of all applicable experience is included in the study. Methodology: Conversion factors developed for use in combining individual claim categories (hospital, attending physician, chemotherapy, etc See SOA Table Identities 1460-1475, 1483-1485, and 2587-2596) into an all-payment claim cost. These factors may be helpful in determining claim reserves and liabilities of companies reserving on the all-payment basis. To convert each-payment claim cost to an all-payment claim cost multiply A x B x C where A: All payment Conversion Factor of this table; B: an interest rate factor specified in the application valuation standard, and C: each-payment claim cost. Data Transcription Errors: None. Data Certified: 12/2012.

MetaData.TableDescription: 1985 National Association of Insurance Commissioners (NAIC) Cancer Claim Cost Table All-Payment Conversion Factors. Minimum Attained Age: 15. Maximum Attained Age: 99
